channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: The ‘brownie recipe problem’: why LLMs must have fine-grained context to deliver real-time results
item.description: Today’s LLMs excel at reasoning, but can still struggle with context. This is particularly true in real-time ordering systems like Instacart. Instacart CTO Anirban Kundu calls it the "brownie recipe problem." It's not as simple as telling an LLM ‘I want to make brownies.’ To be truly assistive when planning the meal, the model must go beyond that simple directive to understand what’s available in the user’s market based on their preferences — say, organic eggs versus regular eggs — and factor that into what’s deliverable in their geography so food doesn’t spoil. This among other critical facto...

item.title: Ikea’s cheap new smart home gear is struggling to get connected
item.description: I've spent the last couple of weeks trying - and mostly failing - to test Ikea's new Matter-over-Thread gear. These highly anticipated smart home devices include programmable buttons, smart bulbs, plugs, and temperature and motion sensors - all of which should work with any smart home platform and start at just $6. But I've hit […]

item.title: Rent-a-Human Site Lets AI Agents Hire an IRL Set of Opposable Thumbs
item.description: Welcome to the future, where you can do TaskRabbit for robots.

item.title: Massive Chinese data breach allegedly spills 8.7 billion records - here's what we know
item.description: Someone kept a gigantic database unlocked on the internet, allowing researchers (and likely, hackers, too) to find it.

item.title: Roblox’s '4D' creation toolset is now available in open beta
item.description: Roblox launched an open-source AI model that generates 3D objects on the fly early last year and now that toolset is getting a massive boost. The platform has introduced a model that whips up "4D" objects. I put 4D in quotes because it doesn't actually allow access to the fourth dimension, but rather lets users make interactive 3D objects via prompts. As suggested, these aren't static 3D models. They are fully functional and interactive objects that move and react to players. The beta toolset can't be used to make anything, as it's rather limited for now. There are just two templates for users...

item.title: OpenClaw’s AI ‘skill’ extensions are a security nightmare
item.description: OpenClaw, the AI agent that has exploded in popularity over the past week, is raising new security concerns after researchers uncovered malware in hundreds of user-submitted "skill" add-ons on its marketplace. In a post on Monday, 1Password product VP Jason Meller says OpenClaw's skill hub has become "an attack surface," with the most-downloaded add-on serving […]...

item.title: The Oscar-Nominated ‘Avatar’ Costume Designer Explains That Yes, Those Na’vi Outfits Are Real
item.description: James Cameron's 'Avatar: Fire and Ash' scored two Academy Award nominations: Best Visual Effects and Best Costume Design.

item.title: A New AI Math Startup Just Cracked 4 Previously Unsolved Problems
item.description: Axiom says its AI found solutions to several long-standing math problems, a sign of the technology’s steadily advancing reasoning capabilities.

item.title: This Ring Video Doorbell changed how I monitor my home — and 10,000+ people bought it last month
item.description: The best-selling Ring Battery Doorbell has changed how I monitor my home, and over 10,000 people have bought it this month – it can be yours for just $59.99.

item.title: Overwatch will drop the '2' as Jetpack Cat and four other heroes arrive on February 10
item.description: Blizzard is running a series of showcases for several of its major franchises and on Wednesday, it was time for Overwatch to step up to the plate. That’s Overwatch, by the way, and not Overwatch 2. The studio is formally nixing the number from the game's name. "Overwatch is more than just a digit: it's a living universe that keeps growing, keeps surprising, and keeps bringing players together from around the world," the Overwatch team said in a statement. "This year marks a huge turning point in how the development team envisions the future of Overwatch, so we are officially dropping the '2' a...

item.title: More than 40,000 WordPress sites affected by new malware flaw - find out if you're affected
item.description: A popular WordPress quiz plugin can be abused to mount SQL injection attacks, but a patch is available.

item.title: I hand-picked 33 home office finds for creating a serene mint green workspace
item.description: Bring soothing calm to your workspace.

item.title: The best VPN deals: Up to 87 percent off ProtonVPN, Surfshark, ExpressVPN, NordVPN and more
item.description: The groundhog has predicted six more weeks of winter, which means more time indoors on our devices — and that means it's a great time to improve your cybersecurity. By subscribing to a virtual private network (VPN) and connecting every time you get online, you can keep your activity hidden from your ISP and any advertisers it may sell that data to — all while streaming sporting events and TV dramas from all across the globe. We strongly recommend using a VPN, but shopping for one takes some care. If you jump on the very first deal you see, you might get stuck with a substandard app. It's also ...

item.title: Our Favorite Pixel Phone Is $100 Off
item.description: While the Pixel 9a isn't the fanciest offering, it is the best value, and it gets even better with a discount.

item.title: Amazon casse le prix de cet écran PC QD-OLED de 32″ à 240 Hz, l’écran ultime pour les gamers
item.description: En choisissant le Philips Evnia 32M2N8900AM, vous avez un moniteur paré pour les jeux compétitifs grâce à ses caractéristiques haut de gamme. Et, pour en profiter, il faut débourser 749 euros contre 1 199 euros au départ.

item.title: X's 'open source' algorithm isn't a win for transparency, researchers say
item.description: When X's engineering team published the code that powers the platform's "for you" algorithm last month, Elon Musk said the move was a victory for transparency. "We know the algorithm is dumb and needs massive improvements, but at least you can see us struggle to make it better in real-time and with transparency," Musk wrote. "No other social media companies do this." While it's true that X is the only major social network to make elements of its recommendation algorithm open source, researchers say that what the company has published doesn't offer the kind of transparency that would actually b...

item.title: The best iPad deals you can get right now
item.description: While the best iPad deals usually land during major sale events like Black Friday, many great iPad deals are available outside of those times. The day-to-day discounts come and go like changing winds, so there’s often some amount to be saved, particularly on Apple’s most affordable iPad, the iPad Mini, and the latest iPad Air. Hell, […]

item.title: Tinder looks to AI to help fight ‘swipe fatigue’ and dating app burnout
item.description: Tinder is testing AI recommendations and insight from your Camera Roll for better matches.

item.title: You can pre-order the Pixel 10a on February 18
item.description:
The Pixel 10a is official, though details are limited. On Wednesday, Google posted a teaser video showing the mid-range phone dancing around colorful backgrounds. You can pre-order the Pixel 10a on February 18. Google hasn't yet revealed the phone's specs. In the short video, we can see a blue model that's virtually indistinguishable on the outside from the Pixel 9a. And alleged leaks point to a phone with few changes on the inside. That (unconfirmed) list includes a 6.285-inch display, dual rear cameras (48MP wide and 13MP ultra-wide) and a 5,100mAh battery.
Google
The teaser's tagl...

item.title: Enormous Pair of Deep-Earth Hot ‘Blobs’ Shape Earth’s Magnetic Field, Scientists Say
item.description: Without the blobs, Earth would be “magnetically dead,” the researchers said.

item.title: Google confirme le Pixel 10a et la date des précommandes
item.description: Fidèle à sa réputation, Google a décidé de couper l'herbe sous le pied de la rumeur en dévoilant le design du Pixel 10a et sa date de précommande !

item.title: ExpressVPN deal: Two-year plans are up to 81 percent off
item.description: If you're looking to up your privacy game on the internet in the new year, you can do so for a little less than usual thanks to ExpressVPN's latest deal. Its two-year plans are up to 81 percent off right now: the Advanced tier is on sale for $88 for two years, plus four additional free months. The Basic plan is where you'll see the biggest discount: it's $68 for two years, plus the same four additional free months. We’ve consistently liked ExpressVPN because it’s fast, easy to use and widely available across a large global server network. In fact, it's our current pick for best premium VPN. On...

item.description: Avec ses premiers écouteurs ouverts à clip, realme s'invite sur un segment en pleine effervescence et propose une alternative économique aux mastodontes du marché. Mission accomplie.

item.title: Lunar Energy raises $232M to deploy home batteries that prop up the grid
item.description: The startup has raised more than $500 million, to date, from investors to build a massive, distributed power plant supported by residential batteries.

item.title: Hackers publish personal information stolen during Harvard, UPenn data breaches
item.description: The prolific cybercrime group ShinyHunters took responsibility for hacking Harvard and the University of Pennsylvania, and published the stolen data on its extortion website.

item.title: Dassault Systèmes lance 3 agents IA qui promettent de « profondément transformer l’industrie »
item.description: Lundi 2 février, la multinationale française de logiciels lançait sa grand-messe annuelle à Houston au Texas : l'occasion d'acter le tournant du champion du « jumeau numérique » vers l'intelligence artificielle. La société va lancer trois « compagnons IA » qui permettront de « virtualiser le savoir-faire d'une entreprise ». Ils assisteront les ingénieurs et designers... sans les remplacer....

item.title: Ancient ‘Dial-a-Poem’ Service Rises From the Grave, Lets You Use Your Phone as a Phone
item.description: There's something rather poetic about a service designed to breathe life back into poetry getting resurrected after all these years.

item.title: 'Companies that are not set up to quickly adopt AI workers will be at a huge disadvantage': OpenAI Sam Altman warns firms not to fall behind on AI - but notes 'it’s going to take a lot of work and some risk'
item.description: OpenAI CEO unsurprisingly positive about AI adoption - except if these headwinds spring up.

item.title: ChatGPT was having some issues — here's everything we know
item.description: Just a day after issues, ChatGPT is again experiencing a disruption with OpenAI confirming an active issue.
